pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Monday, November 1, 2021 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Glasgow, United Kingdom

Private meetings

10:40 a.m. The Prime Minister will arrive at COP26.

Arrival Area, Ground Floor
VVIP Area Building
Scottish Event Campus

Note for media:

  • Pooled coverage

12:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the Opening Ceremony of the COP26 World Leaders’ Summit.

Plenary Room 1, Ground Floor
Plenary Building
Scottish Event Campus

Note for media:

  • Host broadcaster and photographer

1:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with Michael Bloomberg.

UNFCCC Pavilion, Hall 4
Scottish Event Campus

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

2:10 p.m. The Prime Minister will deliver Canada’s national statement, as part of COP26.

Plenary Room 2, Ground Floor
Plenary Building
Scottish Event Campus

Note for media:

  • Pooled and host broadcast coverage

2:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the World Leaders’ Summit event entitled Action and Solidarity – The Critical Decade.

Meeting Room 3, Ground Floor
Plenary Building
Scottish Event Campus

Note for media:

  • Host broadcast coverage

4:40 pm The Prime Minister will meet with the President of Ukraine, Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

UNFCCC Pavilion, Bilateral Room 7
VVIP Area Building
Scottish Event Campus

Note for media:

  • Pooled coverage

6:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a reception given by the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, Boris Johnson.

Main Foyer, Ground Floor
Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum

Closed to media

7:10 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the COP26 family photo.

Main Foyer, Ground Floor
Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum

Note for media:

  • Host broadcaster and photographer
